intro: Rhynchosia minima var. macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered cowpea, is a tropical legume native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy, violet to purple flowers that are typically larger than those of the typical species. The plant has trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets and produces elongated, yellow pods containing edible seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often grown for its ornamental value as well as its nutritious seeds. This variety is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial in agricultural settings.
